section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules—
subsection.def: ACF means available core funding; (L.N. 176 of 2017)
ASF means available stable funding; (L.N. 176 of 2017)
associated entity (聯繫實體), in relation to an authorized institution, is to be construed in accordance with section 97H(4) of the Ordinance;
available core funding (可用核心資金), in relation to a category 2A institution, means the amount as determined in accordance with rule 77; (L.N. 176 of 2017)
available stable funding (可用穩定資金), in relation to a category 1 institution, means the amount as determined in accordance with rule 65; (L.N. 176 of 2017)

Basel III LCR document (《巴塞爾III LCR文件》) means the document entitled “Basel III: The Liquidity Coverage Ratio and liquidity risk monitoring tools” published by the Basel Committee in January 2013; (L.N. 84 of 2019)
Capital Rules (《資本規則》) means the Banking (Capital) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. L);
category 1 institution (第1類機構) means an authorized institution designated under rule 3(1) as a category 1 institution;
category 2 institution (第2類機構) means an authorized institution that is not a category 1 institution;
category 2A institution (第2A類機構) means a category 2 institution designated under rule 3A(1) as a category 2A institution; (L.N. 176 of 2017)

def.name: CentralBank
def.leadIn: central bank (中央銀行) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the central bank of a country; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: CFR means a core funding ratio; (L.N. 176 of 2017)

committed facility (有承諾融通), in relation to an authorized institution, means a contractual agreement between the institution and its customer under which the institution has a contractually irrevocable commitment to extend funds to the customer at a future date, whether for credit or liquidity purposes, in accordance with the terms and conditions specified in the agreement; (L.N. 176 of 2017)

consolidated basis (綜合基礎), in relation to the calculation by an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong of its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR, means the basis set out in rule 11(1); (L.N. 176 of 2017)

def.name: ConsolidatedGroup
def.leadIn: consolidated group (綜合集團), in relation to an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong that has one or more specified associated entities, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution’s Hong Kong office;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution’s overseas branches (if any); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the institution’s specified associated entities;

def.name: Convertible
def.leadIn: convertible (可兌換), in relation to a currency other than Hong Kong dollars in which funds are held by an authorized institution, means that the funds may be exchanged by the institution into Hong Kong dollars through—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an active foreign exchange market; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: core funding ratio (核心資金比率), in relation to a category 2A institution, means the ratio, expressed as a percentage, of the amount (calculated in Hong Kong dollars) of the institution’s ACF to the amount (calculated in Hong Kong dollars) of the institution’s RCF, as calculated in accordance with Part 4 and Division 3 of Part 9; (L.N. 176 of 2017)

def.name: Corporate
def.leadIn: corporate (法團) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a partnership, or any other unincorporated body,

def.continued: that is neither a public sector entity nor a financial institution;

def.name: Country
def.leadIn: country (國家) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), any part of a country; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any jurisdiction;

subsection.def: customer (客户) includes a counterparty;

def.name: DebtSecurities
def.leadIn: debt securities (債務證券) means any securities other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: equities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securities that can be converted into equities; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: import or export trade bills;

subsection.def: determine (斷定) includes calculate;

def.name: EFDebtSecurity
def.leadIn: EF debt security (外匯基金債務證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an Exchange Fund Bill;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an Exchange Fund Note; or

paragraph.name: c

def.name: FairValue
def.leadIn: fair value (公平價值)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an asset (whether an on-balance sheet asset or off-balance sheet asset), means the amount for which the asset could be exchanged between knowledgeable, willing parties in an arm’s length transaction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a liability (whether an on-balance sheet liability or off-balance sheet liability), means the amount for which the liability could be settled between knowledgeable, willing parties in an arm’s length transaction;

subsection.def: financial institution (金融機構) has the meaning given by section 139(1) of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 170 of 2023)
Hong Kong office basis (香港辦事處基礎), in relation to an authorized institution’s calculation of its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR, means the basis set out in rule 10(1)(a); (L.N. 176 of 2017)
HQLA means high quality liquid assets;
LCR means a liquidity coverage ratio;
level 1 assets (1級資產) means any assets falling within section 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 2; (L.N. 84 of 2019)
level 2A assets (2A級資產) means any assets falling within section 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 2; (L.N. 84 of 2019)
level 2B assets (2B級資產) means any assets falling within section 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 2; (L.N. 84 of 2019)

liquefiable assets (流動資產), in relation to a category 2 institution, means the institution’s stock of liquefiable assets, as determined in accordance with Part 8, that the institution is permitted to include in the calculation of its LMR;

liquidity coverage ratio (流動性覆蓋比率), in relation to a category 1 institution, means the ratio, expressed as a percentage, of the amount (calculated in Hong Kong dollars) of the institution’s HQLA to the amount (calculated in Hong Kong dollars) of the institution’s total net cash outflows, as calculated in accordance with Parts 4 and 7;

liquidity maintenance ratio (流動性維持比率), in relation to a category 2 institution, means the ratio, expressed as a percentage, of the amount (calculated in Hong Kong dollars) of the institution’s liquefiable assets to the amount (calculated in Hong Kong dollars) of the institution’s qualifying liabilities (after deductions), as calculated in accordance with Parts 4 and 8;

liquidity transfer restriction (流動性轉撥限制), in relation to an authorized institution, means any regulatory, legal, tax, accounting or other restriction or impediment that inhibits, or may potentially inhibit, the transfer of assets or the flow of funds between the institution’s Hong Kong office and any of its associated entities and overseas branches;
LMR means a liquidity maintenance ratio;
margin lending transaction (保證金借出交易) has the meaning given by rule 39;

def.name: Monetize
def.leadIn: monetize (套現), in relation to an asset of an authorized institution, means to convert the asset into cash by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a direct sale of the asset;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: entering into a repo-style transaction that is collateralized by the asset; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other means;

subsection.def: net stable funding ratio (穩定資金淨額比率), in relation to a category 1 institution, means the ratio, expressed as a percentage, of the amount (calculated in Hong Kong dollars) of the institution’s ASF to the amount (calculated in Hong Kong dollars) of the institution’s RSF, as calculated in accordance with Part 4 and Division 2 of Part 9; (L.N. 176 of 2017)
NSFR means a net stable funding ratio; (L.N. 176 of 2017)
prescribed instrument (訂明票據) has the meaning given by section 137B(1) of the Ordinance;
relevant liquidity event (流動性相關事件) has the meaning given by rule 14(3);
required core funding (所需核心資金), in relation to a category 2A institution, means the amount as determined in accordance with rule 80; (L.N. 176 of 2017)
required stable funding (所需穩定資金), in relation to a category 1 institution, means the amount as determined in accordance with rule 68; (L.N. 176 of 2017)
residential mortgage loan (住宅按揭貸款) has the meaning given by section 139(1) of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

def.name: ResidentialMortgagebackedSecurity
def.leadIn: residential mortgage-backed security (住宅按揭擔保證券) means a debt security—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is issued by a special purpose entity or another company; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: RMBS means a residential mortgage-backed security;
RSF means required stable funding; (L.N. 176 of 2017)

def.name: Sovereign
def.leadIn: sovereign (官方實體) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Government; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the central government of a country;

def.name: SpecialPurposeEntity
def.leadIn: special purpose entity (特定目的實體) means an entity (whether a company, trust or other entity)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is created for a specific purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the activities of which are limited to those appropriate to achieving the purpose; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the structure of which is intended to isolate the entity from the credit risk of an originator or seller of exposures;

subsection.def: specified associated entity (指明聯繫實體), in relation to an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong, means an associated entity of the institution that is the subject of a notice given to the institution under rule 11(1) that is in force;

total net cash outflows (淨現金流出總額), in relation to a category 1 institution, means the institution’s total expected cash outflows, after deduction of its total expected cash inflows, calculated in accordance with Division 5 of Part 7;

uncommitted facility (無承諾融通), in relation to an authorized institution, means a facility granted by the institution to its customer that—(a)is for extending credit or providing liquidity to the customer at a future date; and(b)is unconditionally revocable by the institution without prior notice to the customer; (L.N. 176 of 2017)

unconsolidated basis (非綜合基礎), in relation to the calculation by an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong of its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR, means the basis set out in rule 10(1)(b). (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules, an expression specified below has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Capital Rules— (L.N. 176 of 2017)
subsection.continued: bank (銀行)
credit quality grade (信用質素等級)
ECAI issue specific rating (ECAI特定債項評級)
ECAI issuer rating (ECAI發債人評級)
financial instrument (金融工具)
guarantee (擔保)
home jurisdiction (原屬司法管轄區) (L.N. 170 of 2023)
incorporated (成立為法團)

paragraph.def: long-term ECAI issue specific rating (長期ECAI特定債項評級)
LT ECAI rating mapping table (LT ECAI評級配對表) (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subsection.continued: OTC derivative transaction (場外衍生工具交易)
public sector entity (公營單位)
relevant international organization (有關國際組織)
repo-style transaction (回購形式交易)

paragraph.def: short-term ECAI issue specific rating (短期ECAI特定債項評級)
ST ECAI rating mapping table (ST ECAI評級配對表) (L.N. 170 of 2023)
trade-related contingency (貿易關聯或有項目) (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.continued: Type A ECAI (A類ECAI) (L.N. 170 of 2023)
Type B ECAI (B類ECAI) (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subsection.content: A reference in these Rules to a class includes a subclass (if any) falling within that class.
A reference in these Rules to a formula followed by a number (including an alphanumeric number) is a reference to the formula in these Rules bearing that number. (L.N. 176 of 2017)

If, under a provision of these Rules, the approval of the Monetary Authority is required by an authorized institution in respect of any matter, the institution must seek the approval by making an application in a specified form (if any) to the Monetary Authority.

If, under a provision of these Rules, the Monetary Authority is required to give, or may give, notice of any matter to all authorized institutions, or to a class of such institutions, it is sufficient compliance with the provision if the Monetary Authority publishes the notice in the Gazette.

If any matter specified in a provision of these Rules is qualified by the word “adequate”, “appropriate”, “consistent”, “material”, “prudent”, “reasonable”, “relevant”, “reliable” or “significant”, then, for the purposes of assisting in ascertaining the nature of such qualification insofar as it relates to the matter, regard must be had to any guidelines or codes of practice issued under the Ordinance that are applicable to the provision.

A reference in a provision of these Rules to an asset or liability of an authorized institution is a reference only to an on-balance sheet asset or on-balance sheet liability of the institution unless the provision expressly states otherwise.

A reference in a provision of these Rules to an application that may be made by an authorized institution to the Monetary Authority is a reference to an application in a specified form (if any) to the Monetary Authority.

Except for section 2(a) of Part 3 of Schedule 1 and sections 5(1)(c), 6(1)(c) and 7(1)(c) of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to which section 2(9) of the Ordinance applies, a reference in a provision of these Rules to the relevant banking supervisory authority in a country (including a host country) or a place means the banking supervisory authority in that country or place that may impose the requirements, or determine or specify the matter, referred to in the provision concerned. (14 of 2025 s. 183)

section.name: s2AA
section.heading: Supplementary provisions regarding re-domiciled entities
section.leadIn: In these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong includes a category 1 institution that is a re-domiciled entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a category 2 institution incorporated in Hong Kong includes a category 2 institution that is a re-domiciled entity; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference to a category 2A institution incorporated in Hong Kong includes a category 2A institution that is a re-domiciled entity.

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Use of ECAI issue specific ratings and ECAI issuer ratings
section.content: An authorized institution may use an ECAI issue specific rating or an ECAI issuer rating for the purposes of these Rules only if the rating fulfils the requirements specified in section 4B(1)(a), (b), (c) and (d) of the Capital Rules.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Designation of category 1 institution

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to an authorized institution, designate the institution as a category 1 institution.

subsection.leadIn: The designation may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Monetary Authority’s own volition, if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that any of the grounds specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 is applicable to the institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on application by the institution, if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that any of the grounds specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 is applicable to the institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subparagraph (i) does not apply to the institution, but the Monetary Authority is satisfied that all the grounds specified in Part 2 of that Schedule are applicable to the institution.

subsection.leadIn: The designation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.content: Despite subrule (1), the Monetary Authority may decide not to designate an authorized institution as a category 1 institution in the circumstances specified in Part 3 of Schedule 1.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has been designated as a category 1 institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that had the designation not been made, the Monetary Authority would not make the designation,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, on the Monetary Authority’s own volition or on application by the institution, by notice in writing to the institution, revoke the designation.

subsection.leadIn: The revocation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.content: A decision made by the Monetary Authority under subrule (1) or (5) is a decision to which section 101B(1) of the Ordinance applies.

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Designation of category 2A institution

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to a category 2 institution, designate the institution as a category 2A institution.

subsection.leadIn: The designation may be made if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that it is prudent and reasonable to apply Division 2 of Part 3A to the institution, after taking into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the size of its business operation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the liquidity risks associated with it.

subsection.leadIn: The designation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a category 2 institution has been designated as a category 2A institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that had the designation not been made, the Monetary Authority would not make the designation,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, on the Monetary Authority’s own volition or on application by the institution, by notice in writing to the institution, revoke the designation.

subsection.leadIn: The revocation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.content: A decision made by the Monetary Authority under subrule (1) or (4) is a decision to which section 101B(1) of the Ordinance applies.

To avoid doubt, if the Monetary Authority designates, under rule 3(1), a category 2A institution as a category 1 institution, the institution ceases to be a category 2A institution immediately on the taking effect of the designation as a category 1 institution.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Minimum LCR, Notifiable Matters Concerning LCR and Monetization of HQLA in Certain Financial Circumstances: for Category 1 Institution

section.name: s4
section.heading: Minimum LCR applicable to category 1 institution

subsection.content: Subject to subrule (3), a category 1 institution must, on and after 1 January 2019, at all times maintain an LCR of not less than 100%.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (3), a category 1 institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the year of 2015, at all times maintain an LCR of not less than 60%;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the year of 2016, at all times maintain an LCR of not less than 70%;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during the year of 2017, at all times maintain an LCR of not less than 80%; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: during the year of 2018, at all times maintain an LCR of not less than 90%.

subsection.content: A category 1 institution does not contravene subrule (1) or (2) if the institution’s failure to maintain an LCR as required is due only to the institution’s monetization of its HQLA as provided for in rule 6.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Category 1 institution must notify Monetary Authority of any matter that will or may cause it to maintain LCR less than as required under rule 4

subsection.leadIn: If a category 1 institution has reason to believe that a likely increase in its total net cash outflows or a likely reduction in its HQLA (or any combination of the increase and the reduction) will cause, or could reasonably be construed as potentially causing, whether by itself or in conjunction with any other event, the institution’s failure to maintain an LCR as required under rule 4, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as is practicable notify the Monetary Authority of the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the matter that the Monetary Authority requests.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, subrule (1) does not apply in the case of a relevant liquidity event.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Monetization of HQLA in certain financial circumstances
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a category 1 institution is undergoing significant financial stress; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution’s financial circumstances are such that, in order to meet its financial obligations as they fall due, it has no reasonable alternative other than to monetize its HQLA to the extent necessary to meet those obligations, even though this might cause it to maintain an LCR less than as required under rule 4,

section.continued: it may monetize its HQLA to that extent in order to meet those obligations.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Minimum LMR and Notifiable Matters Concerning LMR: for Category 2 Institution

section.name: s7
section.heading: Minimum LMR applicable to category 2 institution
section.content: A category 2 institution must maintain an LMR of not less than 25% on average in each calendar month.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Category 2 institution must notify Monetary Authority of any matter that will or may cause it to maintain LMR less than as required under rule 7

subsection.leadIn: If a category 2 institution has reason to believe that a likely increase in its qualifying liabilities (after deductions) or a likely reduction in its liquefiable assets (or any combination of the increase and the reduction) will cause, or could reasonably be construed as potentially causing, whether by itself or in conjunction with any other event, the institution’s failure to maintain an LMR as required under rule 7, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as is practicable notify the Monetary Authority of the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the matter that the Monetary Authority requests.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, subrule (1) does not apply in the case of a relevant liquidity event.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Minimum NSFR, Self-rectification of NSFR Shortfall and Notifiable Matters Concerning NSFR: for Category 1 Institution

section.name: s8A
section.heading: Minimum NSFR applicable to category 1 institution
section.content: Subject to rule 8B, a category 1 institution must at all times maintain an NSFR of not less than 100%.

section.name: s8B
section.heading: Self-rectification of NSFR shortfall

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies to a category 1 institution if the institution’s NSFR—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes less than 100% but not less than 90% at any time on a day (first shortfall day); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been not less than 100% at all times in the 12-month period immediately before the first shortfall day.

subsection.leadIn: Rule 8A does not apply to the institution between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first shortfall day (including that day); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the earlier of the occurrence of the following—

subparagraph.content: the expiry of the period of 30 calendar days after the first shortfall day;
the institution’s NSFR becoming less than 90%.

section.name: s8C
section.heading: Category 1 institution must notify Monetary Authority on rule 8B becoming applicable
section.leadIn: If rule 8B becomes applicable to a category 1 institution, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as is practicable notify the Monetary Authority of the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the matter that the Monetary Authority requests.

section.name: s8D
section.heading: Minimum CFR applicable to category 2A institution
section.leadIn: A category 2A institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the year of 2018, maintain a CFR of not less than 50% on average in each calendar month; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on and after 1 January 2019, maintain a CFR of not less than 75% on average in each calendar month.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Valuation of Assets, etc., at Fair Value and Bases of Calculation for Purposes of LCR, LMR, NSFR and CFR

section.name: s9
section.heading: Valuation of assets, liabilities, off-balance sheet items and cash flows measured at fair value

subsection.content: If an authorized institution measures any asset, liability, off-balance sheet item or cash flow at fair value, for the purposes of calculating its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR, the institution must establish and maintain valuation systems, controls and procedures that are effective to ensure that the valuation of any such asset, liability, off-balance sheet item or cash flow is prudent and reliable. (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (1), an authorized institution must make adjustments, where appropriate, to the valuation of any asset, liability, off-balance sheet item or cash flow that is measured at fair value to account for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the limitations of the valuation model or methodology and the data used by the institution in the valuation process;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the liquidity of the asset, liability, off-balance sheet item or cash flow; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other relevant factors that might reasonably be expected to affect the prudence and reliability of the valuation of the asset, liability, off-balance sheet item or cash flow.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, adjustments made by an authorized institution in accordance with this rule may exceed adjustments made by the institution in accordance with the financial reporting standards adopted by the institution.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Calculation of LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR on Hong Kong office basis and unconsolidated basis, etc.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must calculate its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR— (L.N. 176 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the basis that the business of the institution includes all of its business in Hong Kong (being its principal place of business in Hong Kong and its local branches (if any)); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the institution is an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong and has an overseas branch) subject to subrule (3), on an unconsolidated basis (being the basis set out in paragraph (a) with the inclusion of the business of the institution’s overseas branches but not its associated entities). (14 of 2025 s. 185)

subsection.content: An authorized institution may apply to the Monetary Authority for approval to exclude the business of its overseas branch from the calculation of its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR on an unconsolidated basis as set out in subrule (1)(b). (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: On the application under subrule (2), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the institution, determine the application by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting approval to the institution to exclude the business of its overseas branch from the calculation of its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR on an unconsolidated basis as set out in subrule (1)(b) if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the liquidity risk associated with the business is immaterial; or (L.N. 176 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing the institution’s application if the Monetary Authority is not satisfied as specified in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the institution’s application is approved, the approval takes effect—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution’s application is refused, the notice must state the reasons why the Monetary Authority is not satisfied as specified in subrule (3)(a).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has been granted an approval under subrule (3)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that had the business of an overseas branch of the institution not been the subject of the approval, the Monetary Authority would not grant the approval,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the institution, revoke the approval to the extent that the approval relates to the business.

subsection.leadIn: The revocation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Calculation of LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR of authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong on consolidated basis

subsection.content: Subject to subrules (4) and (6) and without limiting rule 12, the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong that has one or more associated entities, require the institution to calculate its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR on a consolidated basis (being the basis with the inclusion of all the business of the institution and one or more of its associated entities as specified in the notice). (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: The requirement takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subrule (1).

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subrule (1), the Monetary Authority may decide which associated entities of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong are to be specified in a notice under that subrule in consultation with the institution, having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the respective liquidity risks that the entities pose to the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the respective activities of the entities fall within any of the relevant financial activities.

subsection.content: An authorized institution may apply to the Monetary Authority for approval to exclude the business of a specified associated entity of the institution from the calculation of its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR on a consolidated basis as set out in subrule (1). (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: On the application under subrule (5), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the institution, determine the application by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting approval to the institution to exclude the business of a specified associated entity of the institution from the calculation of its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR on a consolidated basis as set out in subrule (1) if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that the liquidity risk associated with the business is immaterial; or (L.N. 176 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refusing the institution’s application if the Monetary Authority is not satisfied as specified in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (6)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the institution’s application is approved, the approval takes effect—

subparagraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or
when the event specified in the notice occurs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution’s application is refused, the notice must state the reasons why the Monetary Authority is not satisfied as specified in subrule (6)(a).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has been granted an approval under subrule (6)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that had the business of a specified associated entity of the institution not been the subject of the approval, the Monetary Authority would not grant the approval,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the institution, revoke the approval to the extent that the approval relates to the business.

subsection.leadIn: The revocation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—

def.name: RelevantFinancialActivity
def.leadIn: relevant financial activity (有關財務活動), in relation to an associated entity of an authorized institution, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an activity ancillary to a principal activity of the institution, including—

subparagraph.content: owning and managing the institution’s property; and
performing information technology functions for the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: lending, including—

subparagraph.content: the provision of consumer or mortgage credit;
factoring;
forfaiting; and
the provision of guarantees and other financial commitments;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: financial leasing;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: money transmission services;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: issuing and administering a means of payment, including—

subparagraph.content: credit cards;
travellers’ cheques; and
bank drafts;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: trading for the entity’s own account, or for accounts of the entity’s customers, in—

subparagraph.content: money market instruments;
foreign exchange;
financial instruments traded on an exchange;
OTC derivative transactions; or
transferable securities;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: participating in securities issues, including the provision of services relating to the issues;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the provision of—

subparagraph.content: advice to undertakings on capital structure or industrial strategy, including any matter relating to capital structure or industrial strategy; or
advice and services relating to mergers and the purchase of undertakings;

paragraph.content: money broking;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: portfolio management and the provision of advice relating to portfolio management; or

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: custodial and safekeeping services.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Calculation of LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR of authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong on basis other than those under rules 10 and 11

subsection.content: For an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong, if the Monetary Authority, after taking into account the liquidity risk associated with a part of the institution’s business in or outside Hong Kong, is satisfied that it is prudent and reasonable to do so, the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the institution, require it to calculate its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR on the basis of that part by itself, or in conjunction with any other part of the institution’s other business as specified in the notice. (L.N. 176 of 2017; 14 of 2025 s. 186)

subsection.leadIn: The requirement takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subrule (1).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Authorized institution must notify Monetary Authority of certain matters concerning its associated entities

subsection.content: An authorized institution that calculates its LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR on a consolidated basis as set out in rule 11(1) must give notice in writing to the Monetary Authority of any of the matters specified in subrule (2) as soon as is practicable after the institution is aware of the matter. (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: The matters referred to in subrule (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an associated entity of the institution having ceased to be its associated entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an entity having become an associated entity of the institution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the principal activities of an entity referred to in paragraph (b); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any significant change to the principal activities of the institution or any of its associated entities (including an entity referred to in paragraph (b)).

section.name: s14
section.heading: Prescribed notification requirements for purposes of section 97I of Ordinance

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 97I of the Ordinance, an authorized institution must immediately notify the Monetary Authority of a relevant liquidity event and provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the event that the Monetary Authority requests.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution notifies the Monetary Authority under subrule (1) of a relevant liquidity event that falls within paragraph (a)(i), (ii), (iiia) or (iv), (b) or (c) of the definition of relevant liquidity event in subrule (3), the institution must, at the same time as it gives the notification, also give the Monetary Authority an assessment of its liquidity position, including— (L.N. 176 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the factors contributing to it having to give the Monetary Authority the notification;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the measures it has taken or will take to deal with the event; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the potential duration of the event based on the institution’s reasonable expectations.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—

def.name: RelevantLiquidityEvent
def.leadIn: relevant liquidity event (流動性相關事件)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a category 1 institution, means—

subparagraph.content: (if the institution is not the subject of a notice under rule 16(1) or (2) that is in force) that the institution fails to comply with rule 4 and such failure does not arise from the institution’s taking action under rule 6 to monetize its HQLA to meet its financial obligations as they fall due;

(if the institution is not the subject of a notice under rule 16(1) or (2) that is in force) that the institution is taking, or is about to take, action under rule 6 to monetize its HQLA to meet its financial obligations as they fall due such that the action will cause, or could reasonably be construed as potentially causing, whether by itself or in conjunction with any other event, the institution’s failure to maintain an LCR as required under rule 4;
(if the institution is the subject of a notice under rule 16(1) or (2) that is in force) that the institution fails to comply with any condition specified in the notice;

subparagraph.name: 3a
subparagraph.content: that the institution, subject to rule 8B(2), fails to comply with rule 8A; or (L.N. 176 of 2017)
(if the institution is a rule 37 institution as defined by rule 36) that the institution fails to comply with rule 37(d);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a category 2 institution, means that the institution fails to comply with rule 7; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a category 2A institution, means that the institution fails to comply with rule 8D. (L.N. 176 of 2017)

section.name: s15
section.heading: Category 2 institution must notify Monetary Authority of change of business plans, etc., that may cause it to fall under Part 1 of Schedule 1

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (2), if a category 2 institution’s business plans, or particular circumstances, change, or are expected to change, in a manner that may be likely to cause any ground specified in Part 1 of Schedule 1 to arise in relation to the institution, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as soon as is practicable notify the Monetary Authority of the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the Monetary Authority with any particulars of the matter that the Monetary Authority requests.

subsection.content: A category 2 institution must comply with subrule (1) irrespective of whether Part 3 of Schedule 1 may apply to it.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Action that may be Taken by Monetary Authority when Notified of Certain Relevant Liquidity Event

section.name: s16
section.heading: Conditions that Monetary Authority may impose on category 1 institution when it gives notice under rule 14(1) of event that falls within paragraph (a)(ii) of definition of relevant liquidity event

subsection.content: Where a category 1 institution notifies the Monetary Authority under rule 14(1) of a relevant liquidity event that falls within paragraph (a)(ii) of the definition of relevant liquidity event in rule 14(3), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to the institution (subrule (1) notice), require the institution to comply with the conditions specified in the notice that relate to the institution’s LCR and with which the Monetary Authority is satisfied that, in all the circumstances of the case, it is prudent and reasonable that the institution must comply.

def.name: Subrule,Notice
def.leadIn: If a category 1 institution is the subject of a subrule (1) notice, the Monetary Authority may at any time, by notice in writing to the institution (subrule (2) notice) do either or both of the following as the Monetary Authority thinks proper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend any conditions specified in the subrule (1) notice (including amending by specifying new conditions in the subrule (1) notice);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cancel any conditions specified in the subrule (1) notice (including conditions specified in the subrule (1) notice pursuant to a prior subrule (2) notice).

subsection.leadIn: The amendment or the cancellation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subrule (1) or (2), conditions specified in a subrule (1) notice or subrule (2) notice to a category 1 institution may include one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a condition that the institution must submit to the Monetary Authority a plan, within such period (being a period which is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case) as specified in the notice, satisfying the Monetary Authority that, if the plan is implemented by the institution, it would maintain, within a period reasonable in all the circumstances of the case, an LCR as required under rule 4;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a condition that the institution must start to implement the plan—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a condition that the institution must reduce its liquidity risk exposures in such manner, or adopt such measures, as are specified in the notice which, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, will cause the institution to maintain, within a period reasonable in all the circumstances of the case, an LCR as required under rule 4;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a condition that the institution must make such reports regarding its LCR to the Monetary Authority as are specified in the notice.

subsection.content: A category 1 institution must comply with the conditions specified in a notice given to it under this rule.
A decision made by the Monetary Authority under subrule (1) or (2)(a) is a decision to which section 101B(1) of the Ordinance applies.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 7 and Schedule 4A
section.leadIn: In this Part and Schedule 4A— (L.N. 176 of 2017)
section.def: approved RMBS (經批准RMBS) means an RMBS that falls within section 3(b) of Part 2 of Schedule 2;

def.name: CoveredBond
def.leadIn: covered bond (資產覆蓋債券) means a bond issued by a bank or mortgage corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is subject to relevant laws or regulations specially designed to protect the holder of the bond; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the proceeds from the issue of which must, in conformity with those relevant laws or regulations, be invested in assets—

subparagraph.content: that, during the whole period of the validity of the bond, are capable of covering claims attached to the bond; and

section.def: haircut (扣減), in relation to an asset held, or pledged to a counterparty, by a category 1 institution, means any adjustment to be applied to the principal amount of the asset for calculating the institution’s LCR or other purposes, to take into account possible future fluctuations in the monetizable value of the asset;

def.name: HostCountry
def.leadIn: host country (業務所在國家), in relation to a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong, means a country outside Hong Kong in which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any of the institution’s overseas branches operates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the institution’s associated entities is incorporated;

section.def: HQLA qualifying asset (HQLA合資格資產) means an asset referred to in rule 25(a);

def.name: PrincipalAmount
def.leadIn: principal amount (本金額)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an on-balance sheet item of a category 1 institution, means—

subparagraph.content: if the item is measured at fair value, the value of the item determined in accordance with rule 9; or
if the item is not measured at fair value, the book value (including any accrued interest) of the item; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an off-balance sheet item of a category 1 institution, means—

subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraphs (ii) and (iii), the contracted amount;
for an undrawn facility, the amount of the undrawn facility; or
for a partially drawn facility, the amount of the undrawn portion;

section.def: retail deposit (零售存款) has the meaning given by rule 39;

def.name: SecuritiesFinancingTransaction
def.leadIn: securities financing transaction (證券融資交易), in relation to a category 1 institution, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a repo-style transaction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a margin lending transaction;

section.def: small business funding (小型企業借款) has the meaning given by rule 39;

def.name: WithdrawableCentralBankReserves
def.leadIn: withdrawable central bank reserves (可提取央行儲備), in relation to a category 1 institution, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any funds placed by the institution with the Monetary Authority for the account of the Exchange Fund that are repayable on demand; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following funds placed by the institution with a central bank—

subparagraph.content: funds required to be so placed under the central bank’s reserve requirements but only to the extent that those funds are allowed by the central bank to be drawn down by the institution in times of financial stress;
funds that are repayable on demand;

term funds against which the institution can borrow from the central bank a loan on a term basis, or on an overnight but automatically renewable basis, as long as the term funds concerned are still placed with the central bank but, if the amount of the loan that the institution may borrow from the central bank against the term funds concerned and the amount of the funds are different, only the lower of those 2 amounts.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Assets, etc., must not be double counted in calculation of LCR

subsection.content: A category 1 institution must not, in the calculation of its LCR, double count an asset, liability, off-balance sheet item, or associated cash flow, that is included in that calculation.

Without limiting subrule (1), a category 1 institution must not, in the calculation of its LCR, include in its total net cash outflows any cash inflow associated with an asset included in its HQLA for the purposes of that calculation.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Calculation of LCR on Hong Kong office basis
section.leadIn: A category 1 institution must, in the calculation of its LCR on a Hong Kong office basis, determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its HQLA held in its Hong Kong office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total net cash outflows of its Hong Kong office,

section.continued: as if its Hong Kong office were a single legal entity.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Calculation of LCR on unconsolidated basis
section.leadIn: Subject to rules 22 and 24, a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong must, in the calculation of its LCR on an unconsolidated basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the aggregate of its HQLA held in its Hong Kong office and its overseas branches;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the aggregate of the total net cash outflows of its Hong Kong office and its overseas branches; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensure that all inter-branch balances with, and transactions between, its Hong Kong office and its overseas branches are offset in that calculation.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Calculation of LCR on consolidated basis

subsection.leadIn: Subject to rules 22 and 23, a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong must, in the calculation of its LCR on a consolidated basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the aggregate of its HQLA held by the members of its consolidated group;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the aggregate of the total net cash outflows of the members of its consolidated group; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensure that all inter-branch or inter-company balances with, and transactions between, the members of its consolidated group are offset in that calculation.

subsection.content: A category 1 institution must comply with subrule (1) as if the members of its consolidated group were a single legal entity.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Calculation of LCR on unconsolidated or consolidated basis, etc. when there are different liquidity requirements between Hong Kong and host countries

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong calculates its LCR on an unconsolidated basis or consolidated basis, or the basis specified in a notice to the institution under rule 12; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution has an overseas branch that operates, or a specified associated entity that is incorporated, in a host country,

subsection.continued: this rule applies in respect of the deposits and funding of the overseas branch or specified associated entity.

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (1), subject to subrule (4), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any liquidity requirements for the equivalent of an LCR and applicable to the deposits and funding concerned are imposed by the relevant banking supervisory authority in the host country; and (L.N. 176 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: those liquidity requirements are imposed for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: implementing the prevailing banking supervisory standards issued by the Basel Committee relating to the equivalent of an LCR; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: reflecting the prevailing standards issued by the Basel Committee for such types of the deposits and funding concerned,

subsection.continued: the institution must apply those liquidity requirements to the calculation of its LCR insofar as the calculation relates to the deposits and funding concerned.

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (1), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no liquidity requirements mentioned in subrule (2) are imposed by the relevant banking supervisory authority in the host country; or (L.N. 176 of 2017)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authority, for the purposes of the calculation of the equivalent of an LCR insofar as the calculation relates to the deposits and funding concerned, does not adopt those liquidity requirements or does not apply those liquidity requirements to the institution, (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.continued: the institution must apply the requirements of these Rules as applicable to the calculation of its LCR insofar as the calculation relates to the deposits and funding concerned.

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (2), if the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is satisfied that the liquidity requirements imposed by the relevant banking supervisory authority in the host country are, for the purposes of the calculation of the equivalent of an LCR insofar as the calculation relates to the types of the deposits and funding concerned, less stringent than the requirements of these Rules as applicable to the calculation of the institution’s LCR insofar as the calculation relates to the deposits and funding concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content:
has given the institution a notice in writing stating the matter
mentioned in paragraph (a), (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.continued: the institution must apply the requirements of these Rules as applicable to the calculation of its LCR insofar as the calculation relates to the deposits and funding concerned.

subsection.content: If subrule (2), (3) or (4) applies to a category 1 institution, the institution must construe, with all necessary modifications, the other requirements of these Rules in a manner consistent with the application of that subrule to it. (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: deposits and funding (存款及借款), in relation to a category 1 institution’s overseas branch that operates, or specified associated entity that is incorporated, in a host country, means the retail deposits and small business funding of the overseas branch or specified associated entity; (14 of 2025 s. 187)

section.def: specified associated entity (指明聯繫實體)—(a)has the meaning given by rule 2(1); but(b)does not include a re-domiciled entity. (14 of 2025 s. 187)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Treatment of liquidity transfer restrictions in calculation of consolidated LCR

subsection.leadIn: A category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong that has one or more specified associated entities must not, in the calculation of its LCR on a consolidated basis, include the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any HQLA held by a member of its consolidated group (except to the extent that the total net cash outflows of the member are also included in the calculation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any surplus HQLA held by the member.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subrule (1)(b), surplus HQLA may be included in the calculation referred to in that subrule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the surplus HQLA is at all times freely transferable from the member of the category 1 institution’s consolidated group that holds the surplus HQLA to the institution’s Hong Kong office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting paragraph (a) and subject to subrule (3)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the transfer of the surplus HQLA from the country in which it is held by the member concerned to the institution’s Hong Kong office is not subject to any liquidity transfer restriction; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there is no reasonable doubt as to whether the surplus HQLA will at all times be freely transferable from the country in which it is held by the member concerned to the institution’s Hong Kong office.

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (2), for assessing the transferability of the surplus HQLA, a category 1 institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is only required to take into account the applicable laws, regulations and supervisory requirements of the country in which the surplus HQLA is held; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must have in place and maintain adequate processes to identify and monitor the applicable laws, regulations and supervisory requirements referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—

def.name: SurplusHQLA
def.leadIn: surplus HQLA (超額HQLA), in relation to a member of a category 1 institution’s consolidated group, means any of the institution’s HQLA held by the member that is more than the higher of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total net cash outflows of the member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the HQLA required to be held by the prevailing regulations applicable to the member.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Treatment of liquidity transfer restrictions in calculation of unconsolidated LCR, etc.
section.leadIn: Rule 23 applies, with all necessary modifications—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong that calculates its LCR on an unconsolidated basis as that rule applies to a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong that calculates its LCR on a consolidated basis; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong that calculates its LCR on the basis specified in a notice given to it under rule 12 as rule 23 applies to a category 1 institution incorporated in Hong Kong that calculates its LCR on a consolidated basis.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Requirements that Asset, etc., must Satisfy before it can be Included in HQLA for Purposes of Calculation of LCR

section.name: s25
section.heading: Requirements that must be satisfied before asset can be included in HQLA for purposes of calculation of LCR
section.leadIn: A category 1 institution must not, in the calculation of its LCR, include an asset in its HQLA unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to rules 29 and 30, the asset falls within a class of assets specified in Schedule 2 and meets the qualifying criteria (if any) specified in that Schedule for an asset that falls within that class;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the asset satisfies all the characteristic requirements specified in Schedule 3 that are applicable to the asset;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the asset satisfies all the operational requirements specified in Schedule 4 that are applicable to the asset; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the institution satisfies all the operational requirements specified in Schedule 4 that are applicable to the institution insofar as those operational requirements relate to the asset.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Exclusion of non-qualifying asset from HQLA
section.leadIn: If an asset included in a category 1 institution’s HQLA ceases to satisfy any requirement of these Rules applicable to the inclusion of an asset in HQLA (including any case where the institution fails to satisfy any operational requirement specified in Schedule 4 that is applicable to the institution insofar as the operational requirement concerned relates to the asset), the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), exclude the asset from its HQLA not later than 30 calendar days after the date of the cesser; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exclude the asset from its HQLA immediately if it only becomes aware of the cesser after the 30 calendar days.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Management of HQLA and related foreign exchange risk

subsection.leadIn: A category 1 institution must have in place and maintain adequate systems and procedures for the on-going assessment and management of its HQLA in order to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each asset included in the HQLA satisfies all the requirements of these Rules that are applicable to the inclusion of that asset in the HQLA;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an asset included in the HQLA that ceases to satisfy any requirement of these Rules applicable to the inclusion of that asset in the HQLA is identified as soon as is practicable; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without limiting rule 26, prompt action is taken to exclude from the HQLA an asset identified as referred to in paragraph (b).

subsection.leadIn: A category 1 institution must have in place and maintain adequate systems and procedures to manage the foreign exchange risk associated with its HQLA, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: managing its ability to access relevant foreign exchange markets for the exchange of funds from one currency to another taking into account the risk that the access to such markets may be hindered in times of financial stress;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: managing its HQLA so that the HQLA is able to generate liquidity to meet the institution’s total net cash outflows in different currencies; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to Division 4, managing the composition of its HQLA by currency so that the HQLA is broadly consistent with the distribution of its total net cash outflows by currency.

section.name: s28
section.heading: HQLA must have diversification of classes of assets, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A category 1 institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have in place and maintain adequate policies and limits to control the level of concentration of its HQLA within asset classes with respect to the type of asset, type of issue, type of issuer and, without limiting rule 27(2)(c), type of currency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subrule (2), ensure that the HQLA is well diversified within each of the asset classes comprising the HQLA.

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (1)(b) does not apply to a level 1 asset included in a category 1 institution’s HQLA if the asset falls within any of the following types of asset—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: currency notes and coins;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdrawable central bank reserves;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: EF debt securities;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: qualifying debt securities issued by the sovereign or central bank of a country in which the institution is incorporated; (14 of 2025 s. 188)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: qualifying debt securities issued by the sovereign or central bank of a country in which the institution operates. (14 of 2025 s. 188)

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, in relation to a category 1 institution incorporated in a place that is part of a country (Country A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference in subsection (2)(d) to “the sovereign or central bank of a country in which the institution is incorporated” includes the sovereign or central bank of Country A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference in subsection (2)(e) to “the sovereign or central bank of a country in which the institution operates” includes the sovereign or central bank of Country A. (14 of 2025 s. 188)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this rule, a category 1 institution that is a re-domiciled entity is to be regarded as being incorporated in Hong Kong. (14 of 2025 s. 188)

section.name: s29
section.heading: General exclusion of assets from HQLA, etc.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to all category 1 institutions, specify that a category 1 institution must not include in its HQLA, with effect from the date, or the occurrence of an event, specified in the notice, an asset, or a class of assets, of the type specified in the notice, on the ground that the Monetary Authority is satisfied that that type of asset or class of assets, as the case may be, is not, or is no longer, sufficiently liquid in private markets or readily monetizable by other means to be included in any category 1 institution’s HQLA.
Every category 1 institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subrule (1).

section.name: s30
section.heading: Specific exclusion of assets from HQLA, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to a category 1 institution, require the institution, with effect from the date, or the occurrence of an event, specified in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to cease to include in its HQLA the asset specified in the notice on the ground that the Monetary Authority is satisfied that it no longer satisfies, or has never satisfied, the requirement of these Rules as specified in the notice that is applicable to the inclusion of that asset in its HQLA; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting rules 27(2) and 28(1), to make the changes specified in the notice to its HQLA on the ground that the Monetary Authority is satisfied that those changes are necessary in order to mitigate the risks associated with the institution’s failure, as specified in the notice, to comply with rule 27(2) or 28(1).

subsection.content: A category 1 institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subrule (1).

section.name: s31
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to rule 25

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, the Banking Advisory Committee, the Deposit-taking Companies Advisory Committee, The Hong Kong Association of Banks and The DTC Association, and if satisfied that it is prudent and reasonable to do so in the prevailing financial circumstances, by notice in writing to all category 1 institutions, specify that a category 1 institution may include in its HQLA, with effect from the date, or the occurrence of an event, specified in the notice, a relevant asset specified in the notice if the institution and the relevant asset comply with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prevailing banking supervisory standards issued by the Basel Committee relating to the inclusion of the relevant asset in HQLA; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions (if any) specified in the notice relating to the inclusion of the relevant asset in the institution’s HQLA.

subsection.content: If a category 1 institution includes a relevant asset in its HQLA in accordance with a notice under subrule (1), the institution must construe, with all necessary modifications, the other requirements of these Rules in a manner consistent with the inclusion of that asset in the HQLA.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—

def.name: RelevantAsset
def.leadIn: relevant asset (有關資產) means an asset (which may be an off-balance sheet asset), or an asset which falls within a class of assets (which may be a class of off-balance sheet assets), of a type which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under the prevailing banking supervisory standards issued by the Basel Committee relating to the inclusion of assets in HQLA, may be included in HQLA; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under the other provisions of these Rules, is not presently permitted to be included in a category 1 institution’s HQLA.

section.name: s32
section.heading: General requirements applicable to determination of HQLA
section.leadIn: Subject to rules 33, 34, 35, 36, 37 and 38, a category 1 institution must determine the total weighted amount of its HQLA—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b), (c) and (d), as the sum of the total weighted amounts of its level 1 assets, level 2A assets and level 2B assets, calculated in accordance with rule 35;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any of its level 1 assets, level 2A assets or level 2B assets are not available to the institution on the first day of the LCR period concerned, by excluding the asset concerned from its HQLA for that period and irrespective of the asset’s remaining maturity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: so that the sum of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the total weighted amount of level 2A assets; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the total weighted amount of level 2B assets,

paragraph.continued: does not exceed 40% of the total weighted amount of its HQLA (40% ceiling); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: so that the total weighted amount of level 2B assets does not exceed 15% of the total weighted amount of its HQLA (15% ceiling).

section.name: s33
section.heading: Calculation of total weighted amount of HQLA (without reversal of relevant securities financing transaction)

subsection.content: Subject to rule 34, a category 1 institution must, for the purposes of rule 32, calculate the total weighted amount of its HQLA by the use of Formula 1.

center.b: Calculation of Total Weighted Amount of HQLA

td.p: total weighted amount of level 1 assets + total weighted amount of level 2A assets + total weighted amount of level 2B assets – adjustment for 15% ceiling – adjustment for 40% ceiling
total weighted amount of level 2A assets calculated in accordance with rule 35(1)(b); and
total weighted amount of level 2B assets calculated in accordance with rule 35(1)(c).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a category 1 institution must comply with subrule (1) after all haircuts required by rule 35 have been made to its HQLA.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Calculation of total weighted amount of HQLA (if there is relevant securities financing transaction)

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (2) applies to a category 1 institution if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution has entered into a securities financing transaction that matures within the LCR period concerned and the transaction involves the exchange, during that period, of an HQLA qualifying asset of the institution for another HQLA qualifying asset from the counterparty to the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the HQLA qualifying asset from the counterparty satisfies, or will satisfy when it is given to the institution, all the requirements of rule 25(b) and (c) applicable to the asset; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the institution satisfies, or will satisfy when it is given the HQLA qualifying asset from the counterparty, all the requirements of rule 25(d) applicable to the institution insofar as those requirements relate to the asset.

subsection.leadIn: A category 1 institution to which this subrule applies must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the use of Formula 2, calculate the total weighted amount of its HQLA after the reversal of the relevant securities financing transaction concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take the lower amount of the 2 amounts calculated under paragraph (a) and rule 33 as the total weighted amount of its HQLA for the purposes of rule 32.

td.b: Calculation of Total Weighted Amount of HQLA (Adjusted for Reversal of any Relevant Securities Financing Transaction)

td.p: total weighted amount of level 1 assets + total weighted amount of level 2A assets + total weighted amount of level 2B assets – adjustment for 15% ceiling – adjustment for 40% ceiling
max (adjusted level 2B assets – 15/85* (adjusted level 1 assets + adjusted level 2A assets), adjusted level 2B assets – 15/60* adjusted level 1 assets, 0);

total weighted amount of level 1 assets adjusted for the reversal of any relevant securities financing transaction involving the exchange by the category 1 institution of any level 1 asset, level 2A asset or level 2B asset for receipt by the category 1 institution from the counterparty of any level 1 asset within the LCR period concerned;

total weighted amount of level 2A assets adjusted for the reversal of any relevant securities financing transaction involving the exchange by the category 1 institution of any level 1 asset, level 2A asset or level 2B asset for receipt by the category 1 institution from the counterparty of any level 2A asset within the LCR period concerned; and

total weighted amount of level 2B assets adjusted for the reversal of any relevant securities financing transaction involving the exchange by the category 1 institution of any level 1 asset, level 2A asset or level 2B asset for receipt by the category 1 institution from the counterparty of any level 2B asset within the LCR period concerned.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a category 1 institution to which subrule (2) applies must comply with that subrule after all haircuts required by rule 35 have been made to its HQLA.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Haircuts

subsection.leadIn: Subject to rule 38, for the purposes of rule 32—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the total weighted amount of level 1 assets is the sum of the weighted amount of assets that fall within each of the asset subclasses specified in column 1 of Table 1 in Schedule 4A (Table 4A-1) under the asset class of level 1 assets, calculated by multiplying together— (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the principal amount of assets that fall within each of those asset subclasses; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the total weighted amount of level 2A assets is the sum of the weighted amount of assets that fall within each of the asset subclasses specified in column 1 of Table 4A-1 under the asset class of level 2A assets, calculated by multiplying together— (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the principal amount of assets that fall within each of those asset subclasses; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the post-haircut factor specified in column 2 of Table 4A-1 in relation to each of those asset subclasses; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the total weighted amount of level 2B assets is the sum of the weighted amount of assets that fall within each of the asset subclasses specified in column 1 of Table 4A-1 under the asset class of level 2B assets, calculated by multiplying together— (L.N. 176 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the principal amount of assets that fall within each of those asset subclasses; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the post-haircut factor specified in column 2 of Table 4A-1 in relation to each of those asset subclasses.

subsection.content: Subject to subrule (3), the principal amount of assets that fall within each of the asset subclasses listed in Table 4A-1 is the fair value of the assets concerned.

The principal amount of assets that fall within the asset subclasses of currency notes and coins and withdrawable central bank reserves listed in Table 4A-1 is the book value of the assets concerned (including any accrued interest in the case of withdrawable central bank reserves).

division.name: D4
division.heading: Determination of HQLA: Requirements Applicable to Category 1 Institutions that Use Foreign Currency-denominated HQLA to Cover HKD LCR Mismatch

section.name: s36
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 4
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: foreign currency-denominated HQLA (外幣計值HQLA), in relation to the calculation by a category 1 institution of its LCR, means the total weighted amount of its HQLA, as determined in accordance with this Part before making any adjustment in respect of the 40% ceiling and 15% ceiling referred to in rule 32, that are denominated in foreign currencies;

foreign currency-denominated total net cash outflows (外幣計值淨現金流出總額), in relation to the calculation by a category 1 institution of its LCR, means the institution’s total net cash outflows, as calculated in accordance with Division 5 before the application of rule 40(2) to those outflows, that are denominated in foreign currencies;

HKD-denominated HQLA (港元計值HQLA), in relation to the calculation by a category 1 institution of its LCR, means the total weighted amount of its HQLA, as determined in accordance with this Part before making any adjustment in respect of the 40% ceiling and 15% ceiling referred to in rule 32, that are denominated in Hong Kong dollars;

HKD-denominated total net cash outflows (港元計值淨現金流出總額), in relation to the calculation by a category 1 institution of its LCR, means the institution’s total net cash outflows, as calculated in accordance with Division 5 before the application of rule 40(2) to those outflows, that are denominated in Hong Kong dollars;

HKD LCR mismatch (港元LCR錯配), in relation to the calculation by a category 1 institution of its LCR, means that portion of the institution’s HKD-denominated total net cash outflows that is not covered by its HKD-denominated HQLA;
relevant portion (有關部分), in relation to the calculation by a category 1 institution of its LCR, is to be construed in accordance with rule 38;

rule 37 institution (第37條機構) means a category 1 institution that uses, or is proposing to use, part of its foreign currency-denominated HQLA to cover its HKD LCR mismatch in the calculation of its LCR in accordance with rule 37.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Circumstances and requirements under which category 1 institution may use foreign currency-denominated HQLA to cover HKD LCR mismatch
section.leadIn: Without limiting rule 27(2)(c) but subject to rule 38, a category 1 institution may use part of its foreign currency-denominated HQLA to cover its HKD LCR mismatch in the calculation of its LCR only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution can demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that it has a genuine need to use such HQLA to comply with rule 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such HQLA are level 1 assets and have not already been used by the institution to cover its foreign currency-denominated total net cash outflows;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the institution applies the foreign exchange haircuts required under rule 38 in the calculation of its LCR;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the use of such HQLA does not result in the institution holding HKD-denominated HQLA that are level 1 assets being less than 20% of its HKD-denominated total net cash outflows; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the institution can demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that it has the necessary systems and capacity to manage the level of foreign exchange risk associated with the use of such HQLA.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Application of foreign exchange haircuts

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (2), a rule 37 institution, in determining the amount of its HQLA for calculating its LCR, must deduct from the total weighted amount of its HQLA an amount calculated by multiplying together—

paragraph.name: a
