section.heading: Determination of RSF

subsection.content: A category 1 institution must, for the purposes of the calculation of its NSFR, determine its RSF by adding together the weighted amounts of all of its RSF items. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrules (4), (5) and (6) and Subdivision 3, the weighted amount of an RSF item is determined by multiplying together—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of the item; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the corresponding RSF factor specified in—

subparagraph.content: if the item has a remaining term to maturity of less than 6 months or is repayable on demand—column 2 of Table 2 in Schedule 6 (Table 6-2); (L.N. 84 of 2019)
if the item has a remaining term to maturity of 6 months to less than 12 months—column 3 of Table 6-2;
if the item has a remaining term to maturity of 12 months or more—column 4 of Table 6-2; or
if the item has no specified term to maturity—column 5 of Table 6-2.

subsection.content: A category 1 institution must, in determining its RSF, account for an asset that is an RSF item according to the latest possible contractual maturity date of the asset.

subsection.leadIn: For an asset that is an RSF item of a category 1 institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the contractual maturity date of the asset is extendable at the option of the institution—the institution must, if there is market expectation that the institution will exercise the option and thus cause the contractual maturity date of the asset to be extended, account for the asset as if the option would be exercised; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the contractual maturity date of the asset is extendable at the option of a person other than the institution—the institution must account for the asset as if the option would be exercised.

subsection.leadIn: If an asset that is an RSF item of a category 1 institution is not free from encumbrances, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the asset is encumbered for a period of less than 6 months—regard the asset as if it were free from encumbrances;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the asset is encumbered for a period of 6 months to less than 12 months—apply an RSF factor of 50% for the asset, if the RSF factor for the asset specified in Table 6-2 is less than 50%; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the asset is encumbered for a period of 12 months or more—apply an RSF factor of 100% for the asset.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Legal tender notes and certificates of indebtedness

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a category 1 institution that is a note-issuing bank; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: legal tender notes issued by the institution, in relation to which a certificate of indebtedness has been issued to the institution to be held as cover for the notes.

subsection.leadIn: The institution, in determining its ASF and RSF, may choose either to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: treat the weighted amounts of both the legal tender notes and certificate of indebtedness as $0; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: apply rules 65 and 68 to determine the weighted amounts of the legal tender notes and certificate of indebtedness.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: certificate of indebtedness (負債證明書) means a certificate of indebtedness issued under section 4(1) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);
note-issuing bank (發鈔銀行) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Legal Tender Notes Issue Ordinance (Cap. 65).

section.name: s70
section.heading: Permission for treating assets and liabilities as interdependent

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, if satisfied with the matters specified in subrule (2), by notice in writing to a category 1 institution, permit the institution, subject to any conditions that the Monetary Authority thinks proper, to treat the following as a pair of interdependent asset and liability in determining the institution’s ASF and RSF—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pair of asset and liability specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a pair of asset and liability falling within a class of pairs of asset and liability specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The matters are that, in relation to the pair of asset and liability or the class of pairs of asset and liability, as the case may be, on the basis of contractual arrangements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the asset and liability are clearly identifiable;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the asset and liability have the same principal amount;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the liability cannot fall due while the asset remains on the balance sheet;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms to maturity (if any) of the asset and liability are the same;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution acts solely as a pass-through unit to channel the funds received arising from the taking up of the liability to finance the acquisition of the asset only, and—

subparagraph.content: the funds cannot be used to fund other assets; and
the cash flows in relation to the asset’s principal payment cannot be used other than to repay the liability; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution’s customer in respect of the asset is not the institution’s customer in respect of the liability.

subsection.leadIn: The permission takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.content: On the taking effect of the permission, in determining the institution’s ASF and RSF, if the conditions mentioned in subrule (1) are complied with in relation to a pair of asset and liability covered by the notice, the institution may choose to treat the pair of asset and liability as a pair of interdependent asset and liability.

subsection.leadIn: In determining the institution’s ASF and RSF, the institution is to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the institution makes the choice under subrule (4)—treat the weighted amounts of both the asset and liability in the pair as $0; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution does not make the choice—continue to apply rules 65 and 68 to determine the weighted amounts of the asset and liability.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 3 and Tables 3 and 4 in Schedule 6
section.leadIn: In this Division and Tables 3 and 4 in Schedule 6— (L.N. 84 of 2019)
section.def: ACF item (ACF項目), in relation to a category 2A institution, means a capital item or on-balance sheet liability, listed in column 1 of Table 3 in Schedule 6, of the institution; (L.N. 84 of 2019)

average CFR (平均CFR), in relation to a category 2A institution for a calendar month, means the average of the institution’s CFR in that month as calculated in accordance with rule 76; (L.N. 84 of 2019)

RCF item (RCF項目), in relation to a category 2A institution, means an on-balance sheet asset or off-balance sheet obligation or the total derivative liabilities (before adjustments), listed in column 1 of Table 4 in Schedule 6, of the institution. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

section.name: s72
section.heading: Capital, etc. must not be double counted in calculation of CFR
section.content: A category 2A institution must not, in the calculation of its CFR, double count any capital, on-balance sheet liability, on-balance sheet asset or off-balance sheet obligation that is included in that calculation.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Calculation of CFR on Hong Kong office basis
section.leadIn: A category 2A institution must, in the calculation of its CFR on a Hong Kong office basis, determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ACF of its Hong Kong office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the RCF of its Hong Kong office,

section.continued: as if its Hong Kong office were a single legal entity.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Calculation of CFR on unconsolidated basis
section.leadIn: A category 2A institution incorporated in Hong Kong must, in the calculation of its CFR on an unconsolidated basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the aggregate of the ACF of its Hong Kong office and its overseas branches;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the aggregate of the RCF of its Hong Kong office and its overseas branches; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensure that all inter-branch balances with, and transactions between, its Hong Kong office and its overseas branches are offset in that calculation.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Calculation of CFR on consolidated basis

subsection.leadIn: A category 2A institution incorporated in Hong Kong must, in the calculation of its CFR on a consolidated basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the aggregate of the ACF of the members of its consolidated group;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the aggregate of the RCF of the members of its consolidated group; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensure that all inter-branch or inter-company balances with, and transactions between, the members of its consolidated group are offset in that calculation.

subsection.content: A category 2A institution must comply with subrule (1) as if the members of its consolidated group were a single legal entity.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Calculation of Average CFR and Determination of ACF and RCF

section.name: s76
section.heading: Calculation of average CFR in each calendar month

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (2), a category 2A institution must, for the purposes of rule 8D, calculate, for each calendar month, its average CFR on the basis of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content:
the sum of the weighted amounts of all of its
ACF items, as determined in accordance with rule 77; and

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sum of the weighted amounts of all of its RCF items, as determined in accordance with rule 80,

subsection.continued: for each working day of that month. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to a category 2A institution, permit the institution to calculate its average CFR by reference to such days during the month as the Monetary Authority specifies in the notice (and if any such specified day is a public holiday, the immediately preceding working day must be taken to be that specified day for the purposes of that calculation).

section.name: s77
section.heading: Determination of ACF

subsection.content: A category 2A institution must, for the purposes of the calculation of its CFR, determine its ACF by adding together the weighted amounts of all of its ACF items. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrules (4), (5) and (6), the weighted amount of an ACF item is determined by multiplying together—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of the item; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the corresponding ACF factor specified in—

subparagraph.content: if the item has a remaining term to maturity of less than 6 months or is repayable on demand—column 2 of Table 3 in Schedule 6 (Table 6-3); (L.N. 84 of 2019)
if the item has a remaining term to maturity of 6 months to less than 12 months—column 3 of Table 6-3;
if the item has a remaining term to maturity of 12 months or more—column 4 of Table 6-3; or
if the item has no specified term to maturity—column 5 of Table 6-3.

subsection.leadIn: In determining, under subrule (3), the weighted amount of a deferred tax liability that has no specified term to maturity—

paragraph.name: a
a
paragraph.content: if the earliest possible realization of the liability is in less than 12 months but not less than 6 months—the liability is to be treated as having a remaining term to maturity of 6 months to less than 12 months; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the earliest possible realization of the liability is in not less than 12 months—the liability is to be treated as having a remaining term to maturity of 12 months or more.

subsection.content: A category 2A institution must, in determining its ACF, account for an ACF item according to the earliest possible contractual maturity date of the item.

subsection.leadIn: For an ACF item of a category 2A institution that is callable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the item is callable at the option of the institution—the institution must, if there is market expectation that the institution will exercise the option and thus cause the item to be repaid before its contractual maturity date, account for the item as if the option would be exercised; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the item is callable at the option of a person other than the institution—the institution must account for the item as if the option would be exercised.

section.name: s78
section.heading: General exclusion of capital or liabilities from ACF

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may on the ground specified in subrule (2), by notice in writing to all category 2A institutions, specify that a category 2A institution must not include in its ACF, with effect from the date, or the occurrence of an event, specified in the notice, any capital or a liability, or a class of capital or liabilities, of the type specified in the notice.

The ground for giving a notice under subrule (1) is that the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the type of capital or liability, or class of capital or liabilities, as the case may be, is not, or is no longer, a sufficiently reliable source of liquidity for inclusion in a category 2A institution’s ACF.
Every category 2A institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given under subrule (1).

section.name: s79
section.heading: Specific exclusion of capital or liabilities from ACF

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may on the ground specified in subrule (2), by notice in writing to a category 2A institution, require the institution to cease to include in its ACF, with effect from the date, or the occurrence of an event, specified in the notice, any capital or a liability, or a class of capital or liabilities, of the type specified in the notice.

The ground for giving a notice under subrule (1) is that the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the type of capital or liability, or class of capital or liabilities, as the case may be, is not, or is no longer, a sufficiently reliable source of liquidity for inclusion in the institution’s ACF.
A category 2A institution must comply with the requirements of a notice given to it under subrule (1).

section.name: s80
section.heading: Determination of RCF

subsection.content: A category 2A institution must, for the purposes of the calculation of its CFR, determine its RCF by adding together the weighted amounts of all of its RCF items. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrules (4) and (5), the weighted amount of an RCF item is determined by multiplying together—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of the item; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the corresponding RCF factor specified in—

subparagraph.content: if the item has a remaining term to maturity of less than 6 months or is repayable on demand—column 2 of Table 4 in Schedule 6 (Table 6-4); (L.N. 84 of 2019)
if the item has a remaining term to maturity of 6 months to less than 12 months—column 3 of Table 6-4;
if the item has a remaining term to maturity of 12 months or more—column 4 of Table 6-4; or
if the item has no specified term to maturity—column 5 of Table 6-4.

subsection.content: A category 2A institution must, in determining its RCF, account for an asset that is an RCF item according to the latest possible contractual maturity date of the asset.

subsection.leadIn: For an asset that is an RCF item of a category 2A institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the contractual maturity date of the asset is extendable at the option of the institution—the institution must, if there is market expectation that the institution will exercise the option and thus cause the contractual maturity date of the asset to be extended, account for the asset as if the option would be exercised; or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the contractual maturity date of the asset is extendable at the option of a person other than the institution—the institution must account for the asset as if the option would be exercised.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Grounds for Designating Authorized Institution as Category 1 Institution and Exceptions to those Grounds

part.name: P1
part.heading: Grounds for Designating Authorized Institution as Category 1 Institution (whether on Monetary Authority’s Own Volition or on Institution’s Application)

section.name: s1
section.content: The authorized institution is internationally active.

section.name: s2
section.content: The authorized institution is significant to the general stability and effective working of the banking system in Hong Kong.

section.name: s3
section.content: The liquidity risk associated with the authorized institution is material.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: The authorized institution (first-mentioned institution) is so connected to another authorized institution (being a category 1 institution) (second-mentioned institution) that, if the first-mentioned institution were not to be designated as a category 1 institution, such connection would prejudice, or may potentially prejudice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the calculation of the LCR under Part 7 of these Rules by the second-mentioned institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the calculation of the LMR under Part 8 of these Rules by the first-mentioned institution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the calculation mentioned in both paragraphs (a) and (b).

part.name: P2
part.heading: Grounds for Designating Authorized Institution as Category 1 Institution (on Institution’s Application)

section.name: s1
section.content: The authorized institution’s particular circumstances provide reasonable justification for it to be designated as a category 1 institution.

section.name: s2
section.content: The authorized institution has the capacity (including systems and resources) to comply with all the provisions of these Rules that apply to category 1 institutions.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Circumstances in which Monetary Authority may Decide Not to Designate Authorized Institution as Category 1 Institution

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: For an authorized institution incorporated in or outside Hong Kong, the Monetary Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution’s particular circumstances provide reasonable justification for it not to be designated as a category 1 institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it would not materially prejudice the institution’s calculation of its LMR under Part 8 of these Rules if it were not designated as a category 1 institution.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: For an authorized institution incorporated outside Hong Kong, the Monetary Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution is adequately supervised in respect of liquidity risk by the relevant banking supervisory authority of the place of its incorporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution complies with the liquidity requirements in the place of its incorporation that are comparable to the provisions of these Rules that apply to category 1 institutions.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Classes of Assets which may be Included in HQLA for Calculating LCR and Qualifying Criteria Applicable to those Classes

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of Schedule 2

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule— (L.N. 84 of 2019)
subsection.def: associated entity (聯繫實體), in relation to a financial institution, is to be construed in accordance with section 97H(4) of the Ordinance as if the references to an authorized institution were the references to a financial institution;
covered bond (資產覆蓋債券) has the meaning given by rule 17;
haircut (扣減) has the meaning given by rule 17;
probability of default (違責或然率) has the meaning given by section 139(1) of the Capital Rules;
withdrawable central bank reserves (可提取央行儲備) has the meaning given by rule 17.

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, an expression specified below has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Capital Rules—

paragraph.def: standardized (credit risk) approach (標準(信用風險)計算法) (L.N. 84 of 2019)

subsection.content: For the purposes of sections 2 and 3 of Part 3 of this Schedule, a category 1 institution that is a re-domiciled entity is to be regarded as being incorporated in Hong Kong. (14 of 2025 s. 191)

part.name: P2
part.heading:
Classes of Assets which may be Included in HQLA for
Calculating LCR

section.name: s1
section.heading: Level 1 assets
section.leadIn: The following assets are level 1 assets for the purposes of these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: currency notes and coins;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdrawable central bank reserves;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to section 1 of Part 3 of this Schedule, marketable debt securities that are issued or guaranteed by a sovereign, central bank, public sector entity, relevant international organization or multilateral development bank, or that are EF debt securities;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to section 2 of Part 3 of this Schedule, marketable debt securities that are issued by the sovereign or central bank of a country and denominated in the local currency of that country, or that are EF debt securities, and which, under the standardized (credit risk) approach—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: do not qualify for 0% risk-weight under section 55(1) of the Capital Rules; or (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: qualify for 0% risk-weight only by virtue of section 56(1) or (2) of the Capital Rules; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: subject to section 3 of Part 3 of this Schedule, marketable debt securities that are issued by the sovereign or central bank of a country and denominated in a currency that is not the local currency of that country and which do not, under the standardized (credit risk) approach, qualify for 0% risk-weight under section 55(1) of the Capital Rules. (L.N. 170 of 2023)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Level 2A assets
section.leadIn: The following assets are level 2A assets for the purposes of these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subject to section 5 of Part 3 of this Schedule, marketable debt securities issued by corporates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to section 6 of Part 3 of this Schedule, covered bonds.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Level 2B assets
section.leadIn: The following assets are level 2B assets for the purposes of these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to section 7 of Part 3 of this Schedule, marketable debt securities issued by a corporate, sovereign, central bank or public sector entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to sections 8 and 9 of Part 3 of this Schedule, RMBS; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to section 10 of Part 3 of this Schedule, listed ordinary shares. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

part.name: P3
part.heading: Qualifying Criteria Applicable to Classes of Assets which may be Included in HQLA for Calculating LCR

section.name: s1
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—marketable debt securities (level 1 assets) under section 1(c) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security does not fall within section 1(c) of Part 2 of this Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it qualifies, in the calculation of credit risk under the standardized (credit risk) approach, for 0% risk-weight—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subsections (2) and (3), under section 55(1) of the Capital Rules in any case where the debt security is issued or guaranteed by a sovereign or central bank or is an EF debt security;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under section 57(3) of the Capital Rules in any case where the debt security is issued or guaranteed by a public sector entity;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: under section 56(3) of the Capital Rules in any case where the debt security is issued or guaranteed by a relevant international organization; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: under section 58(1) of the Capital Rules in any case where the debt security is issued or guaranteed by a multilateral development bank; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: it has a proven record as a reliable source of liquidity in those markets, even during a period of financial stress; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is not an obligation of a financial institution, or an associated entity of a financial institution, that is not a PSE bank. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

subsection.content: Section 56(2) of the Capital Rules must be disregarded for the purposes of calculating credit risk as specified in subsection (1)(a)(i).
For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(i), an EF debt security must be treated as if it were a marketable debt security issued by a central bank.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—marketable debt securities (level 1 assets) under section 1(d) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security does not fall within section 1(d) of Part 2 of this Schedule, unless it is issued by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sovereign or central bank of the country in which the category 1 institution holding the debt security is incorporated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sovereign or central bank of the country in which that institution carries on a banking business through a branch or subsidiary. (14 of 2025 s. 191)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a category 1 institution incorporated in a place that is part of a country (Country B), the reference in subsection (1)(a) to “the sovereign or central bank of the country in which the category 1 institution holding the debt security is incorporated” includes the sovereign or central bank of Country B; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a category 1 institution that carries on, in a place that is part of Country B, a banking business through a branch or subsidiary, the reference in subsection (1)(b) to “the sovereign or central bank of the country in which that institution carries on a banking business through a branch or subsidiary” includes the sovereign or central bank of Country B. (14 of 2025 s. 191)

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, if a marketable debt security, issued by a sovereign or central bank and with a risk-weight of 20% under the standardized (credit risk) approach, falls within both sections 1(d) and 2(a) of Part 2 of this Schedule, it may, at the discretion of the category 1 institution, be treated as falling within section 1(d) of that Part.
For the purposes of this section, an EF debt security must be treated as if it were a marketable debt security issued by a central bank.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—marketable debt securities (level 1 assets) under section 1(e) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security does not fall within section 1(e) of Part 2 of this Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is issued by—

subparagraph.content: the sovereign or central bank of the country in which that institution carries on a banking business through a branch or subsidiary; and (14 of 2025 s. 191)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of the category 1 institution’s holding in the debt security that may be eligible for inclusion in the institution’s HQLA does not exceed the amount of total net cash outflows in the currency of the debt security arising from the institution’s banking business in the country in which the debt security is issued.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a category 1 institution incorporated in a place that is part of a country (Country C), the reference in subsection (1)(a)(i) to “the sovereign or central bank of the country in which the category 1 institution holding the debt security is incorporated” includes the sovereign or central bank of Country C; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a category 1 institution that carries on, in a place that is part of Country C, a banking business through a branch or subsidiary, the reference in subsection (1)(a)(ii) to “the sovereign or central bank of the country in which that institution carries on a banking business through a branch or subsidiary” includes the sovereign or central bank of Country C. (14 of 2025 s. 191)

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, if a marketable debt security, issued by a sovereign or central bank and with a risk-weight of 20% under the standardized (credit risk) approach, falls within both sections 1(e) and 2(a) of Part 2 of this Schedule, it may, at the discretion of the category 1 institution, be treated as falling within section 1(e) of that Part.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—marketable debt securities (level 2A assets) under section 2(a) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security does not fall within section 2(a) of Part 2 of this Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it qualifies, in the calculation of credit risk under the standardized (credit risk) approach, for 20% risk-weight—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subsections (2) and (3), under section 55(1) of the Capital Rules in any case where the debt security is issued or guaranteed by a sovereign or central bank; and (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), it has a proven record as a reliable source of liquidity in those markets, even during a period of financial stress; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is not an obligation of a financial institution, or an associated entity of a financial institution, that is not a PSE bank. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

subsection.content: Section 56(2) of the Capital Rules must be disregarded for the purposes of calculating credit risk as specified in subsection (1)(a)(i).

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security, for meeting the criterion specified in subsection (1)(c), must not have experienced a decline of more than 10% of its market price, or (if it is used as collateral in a repo-style transaction) an increase in haircut of more than 10 percentage points, within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any period of 30 calendar days during a relevant period of significant liquidity stress since the debt security was issued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no such relevant period of significant liquidity stress is applicable to the debt security) any period of 30 calendar days since the debt security was issued.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—marketable debt securities (level 2A assets) under section 2(b) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security does not fall within section 2(b) of Part 2 of this Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), if the debt security is issued by a corporate incorporated outside the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, it has an ECAI issue specific rating that—

subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1 or 2; or

if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), if the debt security is issued by a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, it has an ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI or that Type B ECAI that—

subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1 or 2;

if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1; or

if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by that Type B ECAI) or the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by that Type B ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the debt security does not have an ECAI issue specific rating and the category 1 institution holding the debt security has the Monetary Authority’s approval to use the IRB approach under section 8 of the Capital Rules (or, if the institution is incorporated outside Hong Kong and is not a re-domiciled entity, it has the approval of the relevant banking supervisory authority to use an internal ratings-based approach that reflects the standards issued by the Basel Committee for calculation of its regulatory capital for credit risk), it is internally rated by the institution as having a probability of default corresponding to the credit quality grade required under paragraph (a) or (b); (14 of 2025 s. 191)

paragraph.name: d
e
f
paragraph.content: it is not issued by a financial institution or any of its associated entities; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: it is not a structured financial instrument or subordinated debt security.

subsection.content: If a marketable debt security has more than one ECAI issue specific rating, the category 1 institution holding the debt security must, for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) and (b), apply section 54E(2) of the Capital Rules to determine the ECAI issue specific rating of the debt security. (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security, for meeting the criterion specified in subsection (1)(e), must not have experienced a decline of more than 10% of its market price, or (if it is used as collateral in a repo-style transaction) an increase in haircut of more than 10 percentage points, within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any period of 30 calendar days during a relevant period of significant liquidity stress since the debt security was issued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no such relevant period of significant liquidity stress is applicable to the debt security) any period of 30 calendar days since the debt security was issued.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—covered bonds (level 2A assets) under section 2(c) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: A covered bond does not fall within section 2(c) of Part 2 of this Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), it has an ECAI issue specific rating that—

subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the covered bond being assigned a credit quality grade of 1 or 2; or

if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the covered bond being assigned a credit quality grade of 1; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the covered bond does not have an ECAI issue specific rating and the category 1 institution holding the covered bond has the Monetary Authority’s approval to use the IRB approach under section 8 of the Capital Rules (or, if the institution is incorporated outside Hong Kong and is not a re-domiciled entity, it has the approval of the relevant banking supervisory authority to use an internal ratings-based approach that reflects the standards issued by the Basel Committee for calculation of its regulatory capital for credit risk), it is internally rated by the institution as having a probability of default corresponding to the credit quality grade required under paragraph (b); (14 of 2025 s. 191)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is traded in large, deep and active markets, characterized by a low level of concentration, and where covered bonds of that type can be monetized through direct sale or repo-style transactions; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), it has a proven record as a reliable source of liquidity in those markets, even during a period of financial stress.

subsection.content: If a covered bond has more than one ECAI issue specific rating, the category 1 institution holding the covered bond must, for the purposes of subsection (1)(b), apply section 54E(2) of the Capital Rules to determine the ECAI issue specific rating of the covered bond. (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: A covered bond, for meeting the criterion specified in subsection (1)(e), must not have experienced a decline of more than 10% of its market price, or (if it is used as collateral in a repo-style transaction) an increase in haircut of more than 10 percentage points, within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any period of 30 calendar days during a relevant period of significant liquidity stress since the covered bond was issued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no such relevant period of significant liquidity stress is applicable to the covered bond) any period of 30 calendar days since the covered bond was issued.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—marketable debt securities (level 2B assets) under section 3(a) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security does not fall within section 3(a) of Part 2 of this Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), if the debt security is issued by a corporate incorporated outside the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, it has an ECAI issue specific rating that—

subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4; or

if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), if the debt security is issued by a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, it has an ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI or that Type B ECAI that—

subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4;

if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; or

if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by that Type B ECAI) or the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by that Type B ECAI), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), if the debt security is issued by a sovereign or central bank, it has an ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI that, if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: bb
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), if the debt security is issued by a public sector entity, it has an ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI that—

subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2, 3 or 4; or

if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the debt security does not have an ECAI issue specific rating and the category 1 institution holding the debt security has the Monetary Authority’s approval to use the IRB approach under section 8 of the Capital Rules (or, if the institution is incorporated outside Hong Kong and is not a re-domiciled entity, it has the approval of the relevant banking supervisory authority to use an internal ratings-based approach that reflects the standards issued by the Basel Committee for calculation of its regulatory capital for credit risk), it is internally rated by the institution as having a probability of default corresponding to the credit quality grade required under paragraph (a), (b), (ba) or (bb); (14 of 2025 s. 191)

paragraph.name: d
e
f
paragraph.content: it is not issued by a financial institution, or an associated entity of a financial institution, that is not a PSE bank; and (L.N. 84 of 2019)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: it is not a structured financial instrument or subordinated debt security.

subsection.content: If a marketable debt security has more than one ECAI issue specific rating, the category 1 institution holding the debt security must, for the purposes of subsection (1)(a), (b), (ba) and (bb), apply section 54E(2) of the Capital Rules to determine the ECAI issue specific rating of the debt security. (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: A marketable debt security, for meeting the criterion specified in subsection (1)(e), must not have experienced a decline of more than 20% of its market price, or (if it is used as collateral in a repo-style transaction) an increase in haircut of more than 20 percentage points, within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any period of 30 calendar days during a relevant period of significant liquidity stress since the debt security was issued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no such relevant period of significant liquidity stress is applicable to the debt security) any period of 30 calendar days since the debt security was issued.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—RMBS (level 2B assets) under section 3(b) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: An RMBS does not fall within section 3(b) of Part 2 of this Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has the approval of the Monetary Authority under section 9 of this Part;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), if the RMBS is issued by a public sector entity, financial institution or corporate incorporated outside the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, it has a long-term ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI that, if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the RMBS being assigned a credit quality grade of 1 or 2; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (e) and subsection (2), if the RMBS is issued by a public sector entity, financial institution or corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, it has a long-term ECAI issue specific rating—

subparagraph.content: assigned by a Type A ECAI that, if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the RMBS being assigned a credit quality grade of 1 or 2; or

assigned by that Type B ECAI that, if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs, would result in the RMBS being assigned a credit quality grade of 1; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: it does not have an ECAI issue specific rating assigned by a Type A ECAI that is, or is ranked lower than, AA- or Aa3 (or its equivalent rating); (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: f
g
h
paragraph.content: it is backed by a pool of residential mortgage loans that have full recourse to the mortgagor and the weighted average loan-to-value ratio of which does not exceed 80% at the time when the RMBS is issued; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: it is subject to regulations which require issuers of the RMBS to retain an interest in the RMBS.

subsection.content: If an RMBS has more than one ECAI issue specific rating, the category 1 institution holding the RMBS must, for the purposes of subsection (1)(c) and (d), apply section 54E(2) of the Capital Rules to determine the ECAI issue specific rating of the RMBS. (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: An RMBS, for meeting the criterion specified in subsection (1)(g), must not have experienced a decline of more than 20% of its market price, or (if it is used as collateral in a repo-style transaction) an increase in haircut of more than 20 percentage points, within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any period of 30 calendar days during a relevant period of significant liquidity stress since the RMBS was issued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no such relevant period of significant liquidity stress is applicable to the RMBS) any period of 30 calendar days since the RMBS was issued.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, the underlying assets of the RMBS must not contain any structured financial instrument.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Category 1 institution requires Monetary Authority’s approval to include RMBS in its HQLA

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing to a category 1 institution that has made an application to the Monetary Authority for the grant of an approval under this subsection, determine the application by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: granting approval to the institution, with effect from the date, or the occurrence of an event, specified in the notice, to include the RMBS specified in the notice in its HQLA if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that RMBS satisfies the requirements of section 8 of this Part applicable to it; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the institution has in place and maintains adequate systems and measures to monitor and control the risks associated with holding that RMBS; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Monetary Authority is not satisfied as referred to in paragraph (a), refusing to grant the approval and specifying in the notice the reasons why the Monetary Authority is not so satisfied.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority grants an approval under subsection (1)(a) to a category 1 institution, the approval may be granted subject to any conditions that the Monetary Authority thinks proper to attach to the approval in any particular case.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2), the Monetary Authority may at any time, by notice in writing to a category 1 institution in respect of which the Monetary Authority has granted an approval under subsection (1)(a), do either or both of the following as the Monetary Authority thinks proper—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attach to the approval any conditions (including those for amending the conditions already attached to the approval);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cancel any conditions attached to the approval.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (3), the conditions or cancellation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Qualifying criteria—listed ordinary shares (level 2B assets) under section 3(c) of Part 2 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: A listed ordinary share does not fall within section 3(c) of Part 2 of this Schedule unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is not issued by a financial institution or an associated entity of a financial institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is listed and traded on an exchange, and its trading is cleared by a central counterparty;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: it is a constituent of—

subparagraph.content: the Hang Seng Index or MSCI Hong Kong Index; or

subparagraph.leadIn: a stock index specified by the relevant banking supervisory authority of a country outside Hong Kong, where the following conditions are met—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the category 1 institution holding the share is incorporated in that country and is not a re-domiciled entity, or the category 1 institution carries on a banking business through a branch or subsidiary in that country; and (14 of 2025 s. 191)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the supervisory authority’s liquidity requirements on level 2B assets are consistent with, and no less stringent than, the relevant requirements referred to in paragraph 54(c) of the Basel III LCR document;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: it is denominated— (14 of 2025 s. 191)

subparagraph.content: (if the category 1 institution is not a re-domiciled entity) in Hong Kong dollars or in the local currency of the country in which the institution holding the share is incorporated or carries on a banking business through a branch or subsidiary; or

(if the category 1 institution is a re-domiciled entity) in Hong Kong dollars or in the local currency of the country in which the institution holding the share carries on a banking business through a branch or subsidiary; (14 of 2025 s. 191)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: it is traded in large, deep and active markets, characterized by a low level of concentration, and where a share of that type can be monetized through direct sale or repo-style transactions; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), it has a proven record as a reliable source of liquidity in those markets, even during a period of financial stress.

subsection.leadIn: A listed ordinary share, for meeting the criterion specified in subsection (1)(f), must not have experienced a decline of more than 40% of its market price, or (if it is used as collateral in a repo-style transaction) an increase in haircut of more than 40 percentage points, within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any period of 30 calendar days during a relevant period of significant liquidity stress since the share was listed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if no such relevant period of significant liquidity stress is applicable to the share) any period of 30 calendar days since the share was listed.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Characteristic Requirements that Asset must Satisfy before it can be Included in HQLA for Purposes of Calculation of LCR

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of Schedule 3
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: general wrong-way risk (一般錯向風險) is to be construed in accordance with section 226E(3)(b) of the Capital Rules;
haircut (扣減) has the meaning given by rule 17;
specific wrong-way risk (特定錯向風險) has the meaning given by section 226A of the Capital Rules.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Principal characteristic
section.content: Subject to section 3 of this Schedule, the asset must at all times be immediately monetizable with little or no loss of value.

section.name: s3
section.heading: General characteristics
section.leadIn: The asset does not fall within section 2 of this Schedule unless it has the following characteristics—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risks (including any risk of default) that are associated with the asset are so low that they do not prejudice the asset’s ability to be monetizable as specified in section 2 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the value of the asset is readily identifiable and measurable, and can be readily agreed on by the parties to a transaction involving the asset, by reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the asset’s book value;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the asset’s current market price; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a simple valuation method or pricing formula based on publicly available market data;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the asset is a structured financial instrument, the structure of the instrument is simple and standardized;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the asset does not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: have a strong correlation with another asset that has a material risk; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: significantly expose the holder of the asset to specific wrong-way risk or general wrong-way risk;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the asset is traded in a secondary market—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the market is active and sizable having regard to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the diversity and large number of participants in the market;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the presence of committed market makers; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the high volumes and low pricing spreads traded in the market;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the asset is able to be readily monetized without a substantial discount or haircut to its market price; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the historical volatility associated with the trading prices and spreads of the asset are low;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the asset is listed on an exchange, the exchange is a recognized exchange; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the asset is denominated in Hong Kong dollars or in a currency freely convertible into Hong Kong dollars.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Operational Requirements that Category 1 Institution and Asset must Satisfy before Asset can be Included in HQLA for Purposes of Calculation of LCR

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of Schedule 4
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: approved RMBS (經批准RMBS) has the meaning given by rule 17;
credit enhancement (信用提升) has the meaning given by section 227(1) of the Capital Rules;
derivative contract (衍生工具合約) has the meaning given by rule 39;
market risk (市場風險) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Capital Rules;
securities financing transaction (證券融資交易) has the meaning given by rule 17.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Operational requirements

subsection.content: The category 1 institution must have in place and maintain adequate operational capacity and systems to readily monetize any asset in its HQLA without being constrained by its internal business or risk management strategy.

subsection.leadIn: The category 1 institution’s HQLA must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: managed by a liquidity management function designated by the institution for the purpose (designated function) which has the continuous authority and legal and operational capability to monetize any asset included in the institution’s HQLA; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), maintained in a separate pool of assets under the control of the designated function with the sole intent of being used as a source of contingency funding.

subsection.leadIn: The category 1 institution does not need to satisfy subsection (2)(b) if it demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designated function can monetize any asset in the institution’s HQLA at any time within a period of financial stress that lasts for 30 calendar days; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceeds of monetizing any asset in the institution’s HQLA are available to the designated function throughout a period of financial stress that lasts for 30 calendar days without direct conflict with the institution’s internal business or risk management strategy.

subsection.content: The category 1 institution periodically monetizes a representative portion of its HQLA to test or verify its ability to access relevant markets for monetizing assets included in its HQLA in case of need.

Subject to section 3(2) of this Schedule, each asset in the category 1 institution’s HQLA is free from encumbrances and, in particular, there must be no regulatory, legal, contractual or other restrictions that inhibit the institution from liquidating, selling, transferring or assigning any asset in its HQLA.

The category 1 institution has in place and maintains adequate policies and monitoring systems to enable it to have full knowledge of the composition of its HQLA, at least on a daily basis, including the legal entity, location, and custodial or other account in which the assets in its HQLA are held and the currencies in which the assets are denominated.

Subject to section 3(2)(e) of this Schedule, and rule 23(1)(a), the asset is freely transferable and available to the category 1 institution, whether between its Hong Kong office and any of its specified associated entities and overseas branches, and is not subject to any liquidity transfer restriction.

If the asset is included in the category 1 institution’s HQLA and is likely to be monetized through direct sale, there are no impediments to the sale of the asset and there are no requirements to hold such assets, including, but not limited to, statutory minimum inventory requirements if the institution is a market maker for assets of that type.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 2 of this Schedule

subsection.content: In section 2(1) of this Schedule, the reference to the category 1 institution having operational capacity means the institution has in place and maintains adequate systems and procedures, including the designated function referred to in section 2(2)(a) of this Schedule, with access to all necessary information for monetizing an asset in its HQLA within the standard settlement period for the type of asset concerned in the country concerned.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, it is declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an asset is not free from encumbrances if—

subparagraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), the asset is pledged by the category 1 institution, either explicitly or implicitly, to secure, collateralize or provide credit enhancement to a transaction; or
the asset is designated by the institution to cover specific expenses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if an asset satisfies all the other requirements of these Rules for inclusion in the institution’s HQLA but is pledged to the institution in a securities financing transaction or derivative contract, the asset may only be included in the HQLA if—

subparagraph.content: the institution has a contractual right to re-hypothecate the asset, but the asset has not been re-hypothecated and is legally and contractually available for use by the institution to obtain liquidity within the LCR period;
the institution has no obligation to return the asset to a third party on demand or at any time within the LCR period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (d), if an asset of the category 1 institution satisfies all the other requirements of these Rules for inclusion in the institution’s HQLA but is pre-positioned or deposited with, or pledged to, the Monetary Authority for the account of the Exchange Fund, or a central bank or public sector entity, for obtaining liquidity facilities, the asset may only be included in the institution’s HQLA to the extent that the institution has not utilized the asset to draw on those facilities;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the category 1 institution has pre-positioned or deposited with, or pledged to, the Monetary Authority for the account of the Exchange Fund, or a central bank or public sector entity, a pool of assets consisting of level 1 assets, level 2A assets, level 2B assets and other assets that do not qualify as HQLA, and no specific asset in the pool has been designated as collateral for any of the institution’s liquidity facilities received from the Monetary Authority for the account of the Exchange Fund, or the central bank or public sector entity, the institution may, in determining which assets in the pool will be encumbered as it draws on the facilities, adopt the following order—

subparagraph.content: first order of encumbrance: assets that do not qualify as HQLA;
second order of encumbrance: level 2B assets that are not approved RMBS;
third order of encumbrance: approved RMBS;
fourth order of encumbrance: level 2A assets; and
fifth order of encumbrance: level 1 assets;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 2(7) of this Schedule, if the asset is held by the category 1 institution in a legal entity that does not have access to relevant markets for monetizing the asset, the asset is not freely transferable unless the asset can be freely transferred to the institution (or to a specified associated entity of the institution that can monetize the asset); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 2(2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8) of this Schedule, if the category 1 institution hedges the market risk of an asset included in its HQLA, it takes into account the cash flows that may arise from the hedging arrangement (including any early closure of the hedge when the asset is sold) in the calculation of its LCR.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of Schedule 5
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: eligible loan repayment (合格貸款付還), in relation to the calculation by a category 2 institution of its LMR, means a repayment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to the institution by a customer (other than the Monetary Authority for the account of the Exchange Fund, or a central bank or a bank) in respect of a loan—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the institution is not committed to continue, by renewal or otherwise; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that is fully performing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of which is fixed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that will fall due within 1 month;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in respect of which the institution has no reason to expect a default; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the loan referred to in paragraph (a) is secured by a pledged deposit referred to in rule 53(1)—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: (where the loan will not be so fully repaid) consisting only of that repayment insofar as it is not made by a corresponding reduction of the amount of the deposit or interest payable on the deposit, or both (but excluding any repayment in respect of residential mortgage loans referred to in item 7 of Table A in section 2 of this Schedule);

section.def: investment-grade issue specific rating (投資級別特定債項評級)—see section 1B of this Schedule; (L.N. 84 of 2019)
investment-grade issuer rating (投資級別發債人評級)—see section 1B of this Schedule; (L.N. 84 of 2019)
net due from banks (存放銀行同業淨額) has the meaning given by rule 43;
one-month liability (一個月債務) has the meaning given by rule 43;
qualifying ECAI issue specific rating (合資格ECAI特定債項評級)—see section 1A of this Schedule; (L.N. 84 of 2019)
qualifying ECAI issuer rating (合資格ECAI發債人評級)—see section 1A of this Schedule; (L.N. 84 of 2019)
qualifying ECAI rating (合資格ECAI評級)—see section 1A of this Schedule. (L.N. 84 of 2019)

section.name: s1A
section.heading: Qualifying ECAI issue specific rating, qualifying ECAI issuer rating and qualifying ECAI rating
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a marketable debt security or prescribed instrument has a qualifying ECAI issue specific rating if any of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.leadIn: the ECAI issue specific rating of the debt security or instrument assigned by a Type A ECAI—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security or instrument being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security or instrument being assigned a credit quality grade of 1 or 2; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: without limiting subparagraph (i), for a debt security or instrument issued by a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, the ECAI issue specific rating of the debt security or instrument assigned by that Type B ECAI—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security or instrument being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security or instrument being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the issuer or guarantor of a marketable debt security or prescribed instrument has a qualifying ECAI issuer rating if any of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.content: the ECAI issuer rating of the issuer or guarantor assigned by a Type A ECAI, if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the issuer or guarantor being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3;

without limiting subparagraph (i), for an issuer or guarantor that is a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, the ECAI issuer rating of the issuer or guarantor assigned by that Type B ECAI, if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs, would result in the issuer or guarantor being assigned a credit quality grade of 1, 2 or 3; and (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a marketable debt security or prescribed instrument has a qualifying ECAI rating if—

subparagraph.content: it has a qualifying ECAI issue specific rating; or
its issuer or guarantor has a qualifying ECAI issuer rating.

section.name: s1B
section.heading: Investment-grade issue specific rating, investment-grade issuer rating and investment-grade rating
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a marketable debt security or prescribed instrument has an investment-grade issue specific rating if any of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.leadIn: the ECAI issue specific rating of the debt security or instrument assigned by a Type A ECAI—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security or instrument being assigned a credit quality grade of 4; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security or instrument being assigned a credit quality grade of 3; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: without limiting subparagraph (i), for a debt security or instrument issued by a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, the ECAI issue specific rating of the debt security or instrument assigned by that Type B ECAI—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs (for a long-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security or instrument being assigned a credit quality grade of 4; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the ST ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs (for a short-term ECAI issue specific rating), would result in the debt security or instrument being assigned a credit quality grade of 4; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the issuer or guarantor of a marketable debt security or prescribed instrument has an investment-grade issuer rating if any of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.content: the ECAI issuer rating of the issuer or guarantor assigned by a Type A ECAI, if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type A ECAIs, would result in the issuer or guarantor being assigned a credit quality grade of 4; (L.N. 170 of 2023)

without limiting subparagraph (i), for an issuer or guarantor that is a corporate incorporated in the home jurisdiction of a Type B ECAI, the ECAI issuer rating of the issuer or guarantor assigned by that Type B ECAI, if mapped to the scale of credit quality grades in accordance with the LT ECAI rating mapping table for Type B ECAIs, would result in the issuer or guarantor being assigned a credit quality grade of 4; and (L.N. 170 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a marketable debt security or prescribed instrument has an investment-grade rating if—

subparagraph.content: it has an investment-grade issue specific rating; or
